metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3493 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The push_ascii function in smbd in Samba 3.6.x before 3.6.24, 4.0.x before4.0.19, and 4.1.x before 4.1.9 allows remote authenticated users to cause adenial of service (memory corruption and daemon crash) via an attempt toread a Unicode pathname without specifying use of Unicode, leading to acharacter-set conversion failure that triggers an invalid pointerdereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
python-samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
registry-tools - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-libs - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
smbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: samba package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2').
